00037 #include <linux/fs.h>

00050 static void free_dentry_data(struct rcu_head *head)
00051 {
00052         struct ll_dentry_data *lld;
00053 
00054         lld = container_of(head, struct ll_dentry_data, lld_rcu_head);
00055         OBD_FREE_PTR(lld);
00056 }
00057 
00058 /* should NOT be called with the dcache lock, see fs/dcache.c */
00059 static void ll_release(struct dentry *de)
00060 {
00061         struct ll_dentry_data *lld;
00062         ENTRY;
00063         LASSERT(de != NULL);
00064         lld = ll_d2d(de);
00065         if (lld == NULL) /* NFS copies the de->d_op methods (bug 4655) */
00066                 RETURN_EXIT;
00067 
00068         if (lld->lld_it) {
00069                 ll_intent_release(lld->lld_it);
00070                 OBD_FREE(lld->lld_it, sizeof(*lld->lld_it));
00071         }
00072 
00073         de->d_fsdata = NULL;
00074         call_rcu(&lld->lld_rcu_head, free_dentry_data);
00075 
00076         EXIT;
00077 }
00078 
00079 /* Compare if two dentries are the same.  Don't match if the existing dentry
00080  * is marked invalid.  Returns 1 if different, 0 if the same.
00081  *
00082  * This avoids a race where ll_lookup_it() instantiates a dentry, but we get
00083  * an AST before calling d_revalidate_it().  The dentry still exists (marked
00084  * INVALID) so d_lookup() matches it, but we have no lock on it (so
00085  * lock_match() fails) and we spin around real_lookup(). */
00086 #ifdef HAVE_D_COMPARE_7ARGS
00087 static int ll_dcompare(const struct dentry *parent, const struct inode *pinode,
00088                        const struct dentry *dentry, const struct inode *inode,
00089                        unsigned int len, const char *str,
00090                        const struct qstr *name)
00091 #elif defined(HAVE_D_COMPARE_5ARGS)
00092 static int ll_dcompare(const struct dentry *parent, const struct dentry *dentry,
00093                        unsigned int len, const char *str,
00094                        const struct qstr *name)
00095 #else
00096 static int ll_dcompare(struct dentry *parent, struct qstr *d_name,
00097                        struct qstr *name)
00098 #endif
00099 {
00100 #if !defined(HAVE_D_COMPARE_7ARGS) && !defined(HAVE_D_COMPARE_5ARGS)
00101         /* XXX: (ugh !) d_name must be in-dentry structure */
00102         struct dentry *dentry = container_of(d_name, struct dentry, d_name);
00103         unsigned int len = d_name->len;
00104         const char *str = d_name->name;
00105 #endif
00106         ENTRY;
00107 
00108         if (len != name->len)
00109                 RETURN(1);
00110 
00111         if (memcmp(str, name->name, len))
00112                 RETURN(1);
00113 
00114         CDEBUG(D_DENTRY, "found name %.*s(%p) flags %#x refc %d\n",
00115                name->len, name->name, dentry, dentry->d_flags,
00116                ll_d_count(dentry));
00117 
00118         /* mountpoint is always valid */
00119         if (d_mountpoint((struct dentry *)dentry))
00120                 RETURN(0);
00121 
00122         if (d_lustre_invalid(dentry))
00123                 RETURN(1);
00124 
00125         RETURN(0);
00126 }
00127 
00135 static int ll_ddelete(HAVE_D_DELETE_CONST struct dentry *de)
00136 {
00137         ENTRY;
00138         LASSERT(de);
00139 
00140         CDEBUG(D_DENTRY, "%s dentry %.*s (%p, parent %p, inode %p) %s%s\n",
00141                d_lustre_invalid((struct dentry *)de) ? "deleting" : "keeping",
00142                de->d_name.len, de->d_name.name, de, de->d_parent, de->d_inode,
00143                d_unhashed((struct dentry *)de) ? "" : "hashed,",
00144                list_empty(&de->d_subdirs) ? "" : "subdirs");
00145 
00146 #ifdef HAVE_DCACHE_LOCK
00147         LASSERT(ll_d_count(de) == 0);
00148 #else
00149         /* kernel >= 2.6.38 last refcount is decreased after this function. */
00150         LASSERT(ll_d_count(de) == 1);
00151 #endif
00152 
00153         /* Disable this piece of code temproarily because this is called
00154          * inside dcache_lock so it's not appropriate to do lots of work
00155          * here. ATTENTION: Before this piece of code enabling, LU-2487 must be
00156          * resolved. */
00157 #if 0
00158         /* if not ldlm lock for this inode, set i_nlink to 0 so that
00159          * this inode can be recycled later b=20433 */
00160         if (de->d_inode && !find_cbdata(de->d_inode))
00161                 clear_nlink(de->d_inode);
00162 #endif
00163 
00164         if (d_lustre_invalid((struct dentry *)de))
00165                 RETURN(1);
00166         RETURN(0);
00167 }
00168 
00169 int ll_d_init(struct dentry *de)
00170 {
00171         ENTRY;
00172         LASSERT(de != NULL);
00173 
00174         CDEBUG(D_DENTRY, "ldd on dentry %.*s (%p) parent %p inode %p refc %d\n",
00175                 de->d_name.len, de->d_name.name, de, de->d_parent, de->d_inode,
00176                 ll_d_count(de));
00177 
00178         if (de->d_fsdata == NULL) {
00179                 struct ll_dentry_data *lld;
00180 
00181                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lld);
00182                 if (likely(lld != NULL)) {
00183                         spin_lock(&de->d_lock);
00184                         if (likely(de->d_fsdata == NULL)) {
00185                                 de->d_fsdata = lld;
00186                                 __d_lustre_invalidate(de);
00187 #ifdef HAVE_DCACHE_LOCK
00188                                 /* kernel >= 2.6.38 d_op is set in d_alloc() */
00189                                 de->d_op = &ll_d_ops;
00190 #endif
00191                         } else {
00192                                 OBD_FREE_PTR(lld);
00193                         }
00194                         spin_unlock(&de->d_lock);
00195                 } else {
00196                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00197                 }
00198         }
00199         LASSERT(de->d_op == &ll_d_ops);
00200 
00201         RETURN(0);
00202 }
00203 
00204 void ll_intent_drop_lock(struct lookup_intent *it)
00205 {
00206         if (it->it_op && it->it_lock_mode) {
00207                 struct lustre_handle handle;
00208 
00209                 handle.cookie = it->it_lock_handle;
00210 
00211                 CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "releasing lock with cookie "LPX64
00212                        " from it %p\n", handle.cookie, it);
00213                 ldlm_lock_decref(&handle, it->it_lock_mode);
00214 
00215                 /* bug 494: intent_release may be called multiple times, from
00216                  * this thread and we don't want to double-decref this lock */
00217                 it->it_lock_mode = 0;
00218                 if (it->it_remote_lock_mode != 0) {
00219                         handle.cookie = it->it_remote_lock_handle;
00220 
00221                         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "releasing remote lock with cookie"
00222                                LPX64" from it %p\n", handle.cookie, it);
00223                         ldlm_lock_decref(&handle,
00224                                          it->it_remote_lock_mode);
00225                         it->it_remote_lock_mode = 0;
00226                 }
00227         }
00228 }
00229 
00230 void ll_intent_release(struct lookup_intent *it)
00231 {
00232         ENTRY;
00233 
00234         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "intent %p released\n", it);
00235         ll_intent_drop_lock(it);
00236         /* We are still holding extra reference on a request, need to free it */
00237         if (it_disposition(it, DISP_ENQ_OPEN_REF))
00238                 ptlrpc_req_finished(it->it_request); /* ll_file_open */
00239 
00240         if (it_disposition(it, DISP_ENQ_CREATE_REF)) /* create rec */
00241                 ptlrpc_req_finished(it->it_request);
00242 
00243         it->it_disposition = 0;
00244         it->it_request = NULL;
00245         EXIT;
00246 }
00247 
00248 void ll_invalidate_aliases(struct inode *inode)
00249 {
00250         struct dentry *dentry;
00251         DECLARE_LL_D_HLIST_NODE_PTR(p);
00252         ENTRY;
00253 
00254         LASSERT(inode != NULL);
00255 
00256         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "marking dentries for inode "DFID"(%p) invalid\n",
00257                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode);
00258 
00259         ll_lock_dcache(inode);
00260         ll_d_hlist_for_each_entry(dentry, p, &inode->i_dentry) {
00261                 CDEBUG(D_DENTRY, "dentry in drop %.*s (%p) parent %p "
00262                        "inode %p flags %d\n", dentry->d_name.len,
00263                        dentry->d_name.name, dentry, dentry->d_parent,
00264                        dentry->d_inode, dentry->d_flags);
00265 
00266                 if (unlikely(dentry == dentry->d_sb->s_root)) {
00267                         CERROR("%s: called on root dentry=%p, fid="DFID"\n",
00268                                ll_get_fsname(dentry->d_sb, NULL, 0),
00269                                dentry, PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)));
00270                         lustre_dump_dentry(dentry, 1);
00271                         libcfs_debug_dumpstack(NULL);
00272                 }
00273 
00274                 d_lustre_invalidate(dentry, 0);
00275         }
00276         ll_unlock_dcache(inode);
00277 
00278         EXIT;
00279 }
00280 
00281 int ll_revalidate_it_finish(struct ptlrpc_request *request,
00282                             struct lookup_intent *it,
00283                             struct dentry *de)
00284 {
00285         int rc = 0;
00286         ENTRY;
00287 
00288         if (!request)
00289                 RETURN(0);
00290 
00291         if (it_disposition(it, DISP_LOOKUP_NEG))
00292                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00293 
00294         rc = ll_prep_inode(&de->d_inode, request, NULL, it);
00295 
00296         RETURN(rc);
00297 }
00298 
00299 void ll_lookup_finish_locks(struct lookup_intent *it, struct dentry *dentry)
00300 {
00301         LASSERT(it != NULL);
00302         LASSERT(dentry != NULL);
00303 
00304         if (it->it_lock_mode && dentry->d_inode != NULL) {
00305                 struct inode *inode = dentry->d_inode;
00306                 struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(dentry->d_inode);
00307 
00308                 CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "setting l_data to inode "DFID"(%p)\n",
00309                        PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode);
00310                 ll_set_lock_data(sbi->ll_md_exp, inode, it, NULL);
00311         }
00312 
00313         /* drop lookup or getattr locks immediately */
00314         if (it->it_op == IT_LOOKUP || it->it_op == IT_GETATTR) {
00315                 /* on 2.6 there are situation when several lookups and
00316                  * revalidations may be requested during single operation.
00317                  * therefore, we don't release intent here -bzzz */
00318                 ll_intent_drop_lock(it);
00319         }
00320 }
00321 
00322 static int ll_revalidate_dentry(struct dentry *dentry,
00323                                 unsigned int lookup_flags)
00324 {
00325         struct inode *dir = dentry->d_parent->d_inode;
00326 
00327         /* If this is intermediate component path lookup and we were able to get
00328          * to this dentry, then its lock has not been revoked and the
00329          * path component is valid. */
00330         if (lookup_flags & (LOOKUP_CONTINUE | LOOKUP_PARENT))
00331                 return 1;
00332 
00333         /* Symlink - always valid as long as the dentry was found */
00334         if (dentry->d_inode && dentry->d_inode->i_op->follow_link)
00335                 return 1;
00336 
00337         /* Last path component lookup for open or create - we always
00338          * return 0 here to go through re-lookup and properly signal
00339          * MDS whenever we do or do not want an open-cache to be engaged.
00340          * For create we also ensure the entry is really created no matter
00341          * what races might have happened.
00342          * LU-4367 */
00343         if (lookup_flags & (LOOKUP_OPEN | LOOKUP_CREATE))
00344                 return 0;
00345 
00346         if (!dentry_may_statahead(dir, dentry))
00347                 return 1;
00348 
00349 #ifndef HAVE_DCACHE_LOCK
00350         if (lookup_flags & LOOKUP_RCU)
00351                 return -ECHILD;
00352 #endif
00353 
00354         ll_statahead(dir, &dentry, dentry->d_inode == NULL);
00355         return 1;
00356 }
00357 
00358 /*
00359  * Always trust cached dentries. Update statahead window if necessary.
00360  */
00361 #ifdef HAVE_IOP_ATOMIC_OPEN
00362 static int ll_revalidate_nd(struct dentry *dentry, unsigned int flags)
00363 {
00364         int rc;
00365         ENTRY;
00366 
00367         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%s, flags=%u\n",
00368                dentry->d_name.name, flags);
00369 
00370         rc = ll_revalidate_dentry(dentry, flags);
00371         RETURN(rc);
00372 }
00373 #else
00374 static int ll_revalidate_nd(struct dentry *dentry, struct nameidata *nd)
00375 {
00376         int rc;
00377         ENTRY;
00378 
00379         /*
00380          * this is normally called from NFS export, and we don't know whether
00381          * this is the last component.
00382          */
00383         if (nd == NULL)
00384                 RETURN(1);
00385 
00386         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%s, flags=%u\n",
00387                dentry->d_name.name, nd->flags);
00388 
00389         rc = ll_revalidate_dentry(dentry, nd->flags);
00390         RETURN(rc);
00391 }
00392 #endif
00393 
00394 const struct dentry_operations ll_d_ops = {
00395         .d_revalidate = ll_revalidate_nd,
00396         .d_release = ll_release,
00397         .d_delete  = ll_ddelete,
00398         .d_compare = ll_dcompare,
00399 };
